title: Are you allowed to use programs that give you custom skins?
body: Can you use custom skins, without getting banned?

replies.body:
**Wuks** has a great post about this over on **NA**, I strongly recommend you read it [here](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/5dmkJinG-3rd-party-applicationsmodifications-whats-allowed-and-what-isnt).

Essentially **Riot** is allowing custom skins in-game but on a _"use at your own risk"_ basis. If anything happens to your client or game while using them, **Riot** is not resposible. 

They may also change their stance on this in the future and start punishments for its use, so be informed about **Riot** policy when using custom skins. Also make sure your skin program only does skins, unlike MKLOL and others.
The only way you can "Risk" custom skins is if you don't check the skin with your virus or malware software. So basically - be an idiot.

The risk Telecasterdude and Princess Yaia are talking about is that Riot *may* impose punishments even on things that only change aesthetics on the user's end. When push comes to shove, if Riot can't tell from their end whether a 3rd party program is giving a player an unfair advantage they'll most likely punish the player in question just to be safe. Also, as Telecasterdude mentioned, Riot *may* change their stance on "aesthetic mods" in the future to be fully punishable despite not giving any advantage over other players, which is another risk.

The risk of virus/malware software being in such mods is something to be expected and has nothing to do with Riot, but of course still a risk.

While you are correct in saying that it's a third party software, Riot has never really confused the two or when they do, it's always resolved. Though technically on some skins they may be losing money, so I wouldn't be surprised if they decided to ban them in the future, since like you said, they are detectable whether mistaken or not.
